articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 7th in A# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in A# (Shape: C)

## Description
An arpeggio is the sounding of the notes of a chord in sequence, rather than simultaneously. The Minor 7th arpeggio in A# (also known as Bb) uses the notes Bb, Db, F, and Ab, following the C shape on the guitar.

## Notes and Intervals
- Bb (Root)
- Db (Minor 3rd)
- F (Perfect 5th)
- Ab (Minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 7th arpeggio in A# is commonly found in jazz, blues, funk, and R&B genres. It adds a jazzy and soulful flavor to the music, creating a smooth and sophisticated sound. It is often used in solo improvisations and as a chord substitution for the dominant 7th chord.

## Songs
1. "Cissy Strut" by The Meters
2. "So What" by Miles Davis
3. "Fallin'" by Alicia Keys
